root: ^Hi traveller! You look like an educated person. Can you help me sort out one thing?
^Sorry I don't have time for this

Help: ^You see I need to choose a methodology for my final thesis but I have no idea what this thing is or what to choose?
^That's easy, a methodology is like a strategy that will shape and structure your study.
^I'm not sure but I think those are instruments that help you to collect data.
^I know what this thing is. It's the research philosophy or way how you understand the truth,
^I'm sorry I have no idea what you are talking about.
Strategy: ^I see. But what is my strategy if I would like to experiment with games in an educational context?
^That is an interesting question but be careful while using word EXPERIMENT
^You said experiment. Maybe it is an experiment then.
Philosophy: ^No that can't be right. My teachers did not tell us anything about research philosophy.
Instrument: ^No No. My supervisor says instruments are methods. This is a different thing.
Why: ^Why can't I use the word Experiment?
^You can but Experiment is a very specific research strategy
^It's not okay to experiment with students. Education is a serious business.
Experiment: ^Experiment is about finding the connection between the cause and the effect.
^Experiment is testing how the independent variable influences the dependent variable.
Cause: ^So if I would like to experiment with learning games what could be the cause and effect?
^For example what is the impact of using such a game on learning results?
^For example how to make such a game?
^For example how students perceive this game?
Independent: ^So if I would like to experiment with learning games what can be the independent variable and what is the dependent variable?
^For example independent variable is the time how long learners use your game. The dependent variable is the test result.
^Independent variable is the game, the dependent variable is the learning result.
Next: ^Wery well then. What should I do next?
Group: ^What do you mean by test and control groups?
^You need to divide your subjects between 2 groups a test group and a control group.
^Test group is using a learning game.
^Control group is not using the game.
What: ^If they are not using the game what they should do?
^They can learn through some traditional teaching methods like presentations.
^They can learn through some other active learning methods like problem-based learning.
Activity: ^What do you mean by group activities?
^In a test group you use learning games and you test your students.
^In a control group you use some other teaching methods and run the same test.
Measure: ^The typical data collection method in thr Experiment is a Test
^You will run a pre-test and post test
Test: ^You can test the knowledge of your students.
^I don't know, it depends on your Hypothesis
Hypothesis: ^Yes, a hypothesis is a supposition as a starting point for further investigation.
^For example the use of learning games increases the students' learning results.
PrePost: ^You will test your students' knowledge before the experiment and after the experiment with the same test.
^Take a vocabulary and check the meaning of the pre and post.
TooMuch: ^This is too much work. I understand in real science you need to do that but at school? Can it be somehow easier ... less work?
^No school is also real life. How can you practice for real life if you don't try that at school?
Quasi: ^This is an experiment with no control group.
^This is an experiment with no pre-test.
NoControl: ^But the test group is still needed?
Fin: ^Very well then I'll try to solve my issues by myself.
Report: ^Yes, every research ends with writing a report. Thank you.
